summary: This bill, the 9/11 Responder and Survivor Health Funding Correction Act of 2025, amends the Public Health Service Act regarding the World Trade Center Health Program. Key provisions include expanding mental health provider flexibility, clarifying enrollment calculations, extending timeframes for adding health conditions, and modifying funding formulas. The bill also mandates a report assessing the program's budgetary needs through 2090. Furthermore, it addresses the reversion of unspent funds to the Treasury.
